revision.comment: Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/Marco Papavero|Marco Papavero]] ([[User talk:Marco Papavero|talk]]) to last revision by [[User:imported>M86|imported>M86]]
revision.text:
{{Wireless embedded system |brand=TP-LINK |model=EAP225 |revision=v1.x |asin=B01N0XZ1TU |fcc_date=09/24/2016 |is_manuf=No |manuf=Proware |availability=now |type=access point |fcc_id=TE7EAP225 |ic_id=8853A-EAP225 |pwr_v=12 |pwr_amp=1.5 |pwr_conn=barrel |pwr_poe=af |cpu1_brand=Qualcomm Atheros |cpu1_model=QCA9563;QCA9563-AL3A; |cpu1_cspeed=750 |fla1=16 |fla1_brand=GigaDevice |fla1_model= |ram1=128 |ram1_brand=ESMT |ram1_model=M14D1G1664A-2.5B |serial=yes,, 4-pin header,, J3,, |wi1_chip1_brand=Qualcomm Atheros |wi1_chip1_model=QCA9563;QCA9563-AL3A; |wi1_802dot11_protocols=bgn |wi1_ant_conn=U.FL |wi1_txchains=2 |wi1_rxchains=2 |wi1_sstreams=2 |wi2_chip1_brand=Qualcomm Atheros |wi2_chip1_model=QCA9882;QCA9882-BR4A; |wi2_802dot11_protocols=an+ac |wi2_ant_conn=U.FL |wi2_txchains=2 |wi2_rxchains=2 |wi2_sstreams=2 |eth_cpu=true |eth_chip2_brand=Atheros |eth_chip2_model=AR8033;AR8033-AL3A; |lan_speed=1G |lan_ports=1 |addl_chips=2.4GHz Power Amplifier IC;Skyworks;SE2565T;;2; ,,, 5GHz Front End Module;Skyworks;SKY85717-21;;2; |802dot11_protocols=abgn+ac |default_user=admin |default_pass=admin }}
:• '''867Mbps''' - 2SS 5GHz [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_802.11ac#Data_rates_and_speed 802.11ac] (80MHz chan.), :• '''300Mbps''' - 2SS 2.4GHz [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_802.11n-2009#Data_rates 802.11n] (40MHz chan.) = '''''1200 Mbps'' class'''
{{TagLine|AC1200 Wireless Dual Band Gigabit Ceiling Mount Access Point}} :{{ProductPage|http://www.tp-link.com/en/products/details/EAP225.html}}{{SupportPage|vendor=TP-LINK|model=EAP225}} "1604272'''225'''-1.0 Rev1.0sp2" is silkscreened on the board in the FCC photos. {{see also|TP-LINK EAP225 v3.x|Proware}} Missing components prevent the QCA9563 from using all three spatial streams. ===Reviews=== * [https://nl.hardware.info/reviews/7041/tp-link-eap225-review-zakelijk-access-point-voor-een-prikkie ''TP-Link EAP225 review'' on '''Hardware.info'''] ([https://content.hwigroup.net/images/products_xl/365298/11/tp-link-eap225.jpg internal images]) : Says that the 5GHz radio is a QCA9982 which would be 3x3:3 * [https://www.smallnetbuilder.com/wireless/wireless-reviews/33159-2x2-ac-access-point-roundup?start=5 ''TP-Link EAP225'' on '''SmallNetBuilder'''] : Says that the 5GHz radio is a QCA9882 which would be 2x2:2 which makes more sense ===See also=== * [[TP-LINK EAP245 v1.x]]
